snippet: The demonstration — a day after the country’s new “majoritarian” Constitution took effect — marked the first time that opposition forces joined together to rally against a new constitution.
abstract: Tens of thousands of Hungarians rally in Budapest in protest of what critics see as campaign by Prime Min Viktor Orban to undermine democracy and consolidate his power; protest, one day after country's new 'majoritarian' Constitution took effect, is first time opposition forces joined together to rally against a new constitution.

byline.original: By PALKO KARASZ and MELISSA EDDY
byline.contributor: Palko Karasz reported from Budapest, and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: The demonstration — a day after the country’s new “majoritarian” Constitution took effect — marked the first time that opposition forces joined together to rally against a new constitution.
